title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 598-1.16 - References
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 598-1.16 - References

State Regulations

Citations used in this Part refer to the publications
listed in this section. These publications are available for inspection at the

Department of Environmental Conservation, 625 Broadway, Albany, NY 12233-7020. Copies may be purchased directly from the publisher at the address
shown. (a) API 620 means American

Petroleum Institute Specification 620, 'Recommended Rules for Design and

Construction of Large, Welded, Low-Pressure Storage Tanks', June 1990, American

Petroleum Institute, 200 Washington Avenue, NW, Washington, DC
20001-5571. (b) API 650 means

American Petroleum Institute Specification 650, 'Welded Steel Tanks for Oil

Storage', 9th Edition, 1993, American Petroleum Institute, 200 Washington

Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20001-5571. (c) API 651 means American Petroleum

Institute Specification 651, Cathodic Protection of Above-ground Petroleum

Storage Tanks, 1991, American Petroleum Institute, 200 Washington Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20001-5571. (d) API
652 means American Petroleum Institute Specification 652, Lining of Aboveground

Petroleum Storage Tank Bottoms, 1991, American Petroleum Institute, 200

Washington Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20001-5571. (e) API 1615 means American Petroleum

Institute Specification 1615, Installation of Underground Petroleum Storage

Systems, 1987, with 1989 supplement, American Petroleum Institute, 200

Washington Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20001-5571. (f) API RP 1631, June 2010 means American

Petroleum Institute Specification 1631, Interior Lining and Periodic Inspection
of Underground Storage Tanks, 5th edition, June 2001, American Petroleum

Institute, 200 Washington Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20001-5571. (g) API 1632 means American Petroleum

Institute Specification 1632, Cathodic Protection of Underground Petroleum

Storage Tanks and Piping Systems, 1987, American Petroleum Institute, 200

Washington Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20001-5571. (h) API RP 2200, September 2010 means

American Petroleum Institute Specification 2200, Repairing Crude Oil, Liquefied

Petroleum Gas, and Product Pipelines, 4th edition, September 2010, American

Petroleum Institute, 200 Washington Avenue, NW, Washington, DC
20001-5571. (i) ASTM D2996-88 means

American Society for Testing and Materials Designation D2996-88, Specification
for Filament-Wound Reinforced Thermosetting Resin Pipe, 1988, American Society
for Testing and Materials, 100 Barr Harbor Drive, West Conshohocken, PA
19428-2959. (j) ASTM D3299-88 means

American Society for Testing and Materials Designation D3299-88, Filament-Wound

Glass-Fiber-Reinforced Thermoset Resin Chemical-Resistant Tanks, 1988, American

Society for Testing and Materials, 100 Barr Harbor Drive, West Conshohocken, PA
19428-2959. (k) ASTM D4021-92 means

American Society for Testing and Materials Designation D4021-92, Standard

Specification for Glass-Fiber-Reinforced Polyester Underground Petroleum

Storage Tanks, 1992, American Society for Testing and Materials, 100 Barr

Harbor Drive, West Conshohocken, PA 19428-2959. (l) ASTM D4097-88 means

American Society for Testing and Materials Designation D4097-88, Contact-Molded

Glass-Fiber-Reinforced Thermoset Resin Chemical-Resistant Tanks, 1988, American

Society for Testing and Materials, 100 Barr Harbor Drive, West Conshohocken, PA
19428-2959. (m) CAN4-S601-M84 means

Underwriters' Laboratories of Canada, No. CAN4-S601-M84, Standard for Shop

Fabricated Steel Aboveground Horizontal Tanks for Flammable and Combustible

Liquids, 1984, Underwriters' Laboratories of Canada, 7 Underwriters Road, Scarborough, Ontario, Canada M1R5P8. (n) CAN4-S630-M84 means Underwriters'
Laboratories of Canada, No. CAN4-S630-M84, Standard for Shop Fabricated Steel

Aboveground Vertical Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids, 1984, Underwriters Laboratories of Canada, 7 Underwriters Road, Scarborough, Ontario, Canada M1R5P8. (o) FTPI RP T-95-02, January 1995 means Fiberglass Tank and Pipe Institute (FTPI), Remanufacturing
of Fiberglass Reinforced Plastic (FRP) Underground Storage Tanks, 2nd edition, January 1995, 8252 S. Harvard Avenue, Suite 1-2, Tulsa, OK 74137
(p) NACE SP0169-2013, 2013 means Association
of Materials Protection and Performance, formerly National Association of

Corrosion Engineers, Control of External Corrosion on Underground or Submerged

Metallic Piping Systems, 2013 edition, Association of Materials Protection and

Performance, 15835 Park Ten Place, Houston, TX 77084. (q) NACE SP0285-2011, means Association of

Materials Protection and Performance, formerly National Association of

Corrosion Engineers, Corrosion Control of Underground Storage Tanks by Cathodic

Protection, 2011 edition (formerly RP0285), Association of Materials Protection
and Performance, 15835 Park Ten Place, Houston, TX 77084. (r) NACE Standard RP-01-69 means Association
of Materials Protection and Performance, formerly National Association of

Corrosion Engineers, Recommended Practice - Control of External Corrosion on

Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems, RP-01-69, April 1992

Revision, Association of Materials Protection and Performance, 15835 Park Ten

Place, Houston, TX 77084. (s) NACE
Standard RP-02-85 means Association of Materials Protection and Performance, formerly National Association of Corrosion Engineers, Recommended Practice -
Control of External Corrosion on Metallic Buried, Partially Buried, or

Submerged Liquid Storage Systems, 1985, Association of Materials Protection and

Performance, 15835 Park Ten Place, Houston, TX 77084. (t) NACE TM0101-2012, 2012 means Association
of Materials Protection and Performance, formerly National Association of

Corrosion Engineers, Measurement Techniques Related to Criteria for Cathodic

Protection of Underground Storage Tank Systems, 2012 edition, Association of

Materials Protection and Performance, 15835 Park Ten Place, Houston, TX 77084. (u) NACE TM0497-2012, 2012 means

Association of Materials Protection and Performance, formerly National

Association of Corrosion Engineers, Measurement Techniques Related to Criteria
for Cathodic Protection on Underground or Submerged Metallic Piping Systems, 2012 edition, Association of Materials Protection and Performance, 15835 Park

Ten Place, Houston, TX 77084. (v) NFPA 30, 1993 means National Fire Protection Association, Flammable and

Combustible Liquids Code, No. 30, 1993, NFPA, Batterymarch Park, Quincy, MA
02269. (w) NFPA 30, 2012 means

National Fire Protection Association, Flammable and Combustible Liquids Code
2012 edition, NFPA, Batterymarch Park, Quincy, MA 02269. (x) NFPA 326, 2010 means National Fire

Protection Association, Standard for the Safeguarding of Tanks and Containers
for Entry, Cleaning, or Repair, 2010 edition, NFPA, Batterymarch Park, Quincy, MA 02269. (y) NLPA 631 means

National Leak Prevention Association, Spill Prevention, Minimum 10-Year Life

Extension of Existing Steel Underground Storage Tanks by Lining Without the

Addition of Cathodic Protection, 1991, NLPA P.O. Box 1643, Boise, ID
83701. (z) PEI RP900, 2021 means

Petroleum Equipment Institute (PEI), UST Inspection and Maintenance, 2017
edition, Petroleum Equipment Institute (PEI) P. O. Box 2380, Tulsa, OK
74101-2380. (aa)
PEI RP1200, 2019
means Petroleum Equipment Institute (PEI), Testing and Verification of Spill, Overfill, Leak Detection and Secondary Containment Equipment at UST Facilities, 2019 edition, Petroleum Equipment Institute (PEI) P. O. Box 2380, Tulsa, OK
74101-2380. (ab)
SSPC-SP #6 means

Association of Materials Protection and Performance, formerly Steel Structures

Painting Council, Steel Structures Painting Manual, Chapter 2'Surface

Preparation Specifications, Commercial Blast Cleaning, June 1991, Association
of Materials Protection and Performance, 800 Trumbull Drive, Pittsburgh, PA
15205. (ac)
STI R051, January 2006
means Cathodic Protection Testing Procedures for sti-P3® USTs, revised January
2006, Steel Tank Institute, 944 Donata Court, Lake Zurich, IL 60047. (ad)
STI R972, December 2010 means Steel Tank

Institute, Recommended Practice for the Addition of Supplemental Anodes to
sti-P3® USTs, revised December 2010, Steel Tank Institute, 944 Donata Court, Lake Zurich, IL 60047. (ae)
ULC-C107.7-1993 means Underwriters' Laboratories of Canada, No. ULC-C107, Glass

Fiber Reinforced Plastic Pipe and Fittings for Flammable Liquids, 1993, Underwriters' Laboratories of Canada, 7 Underwriters Road, Scarborough, Ontario, Canada M1R5P8. (af)
ULC
Standard S603 means Underwriters' Laboratories of Canada, No. ULC-S603-92, Standard for Steel Underground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids, 1992, Underwriters Laboratories of Canada, 7 Underwriters Road, Scarborough, Ontario, Canada M1R5P8. (ag)
ULC-S603.1 means Underwriters' Laboratories of Canada, No. ULC S603.1-M1982, Standard for Galvanic Corrosion Protection Systems for Steel Underground Tanks
for Flammable and Combustible Liquids, 1992, Underwriters Laboratories of

Canada, 7 Underwriters Road, Scarborough, Ontario, Canada M1R5P8. (ah)
40 CFR
280
means part
280
of title 40 of
the Code of Federal Regulations, Technical Standards and Corrective Action

Requirements for Owners and Operators of Underground Storage Tanks (UST), July
15, 2015, Superintendent of Documents, U.S. Government Printing Office, Washington, DC 20402. (ai)
40 CFR
281
means part
281
of title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Approval of

State Underground Storage Tank Programs, July 15, 2015, Superintendent of

Documents, U.S. Government Printing Office, Washington, DC 20402. (aj)
40 CFR
302.8
means section 8, part
302
of title 40
of the Code of Federal Regulations, Continuous Releases, July 1, 1990, Superintendent of Documents, U.S. Government Printing Office, Washington, DC
20402. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
598-1.16

Adopted

New

York State Register July 19, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 29, eff. 10/17/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
